context: KU football dates from <a0_0><b5_0>1890<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and has played in the Orange Bowl <a1_0><b6_0>three<b6_0/><a1_0/> times: 1948, 1968, and 2008. They are currently coached by <a2_0><b7_0>David Beaty<b7_0/><a2_0/>, who was hired in 2014. In 2008, under the leadership of Mark Mangino, the #7 Jayhawks emerged victorious in their first BCS bowl game, the FedEx Orange Bowl, with a 24–21 victory over the #3 <a3_0><b8_0>Virginia Tech Hokies<b8_0/><a3_0/>. This capstone victory marked the end of the most successful season in school history, in which the Jayhawks went 12–1 (.923). The team plays at <a4_0><b9_0>Memorial Stadium<b9_0/><a4_0/>, which recently underwent a $31 million renovation to add the Anderson Family Football Complex, adding a football practice facility adjacent to the stadium complete with indoor partial practice field, weight room, and new locker room.
